content.description: Often dirty at the beginning of the season. Nice crimps.
content.location: Located on the Right wall. This is the most left climb.

content.description: Easiest route in the area. Do some pinching to some (possibly hidden) pockets and jugs.
content.location: This is the fourth route from the left.  To the right of 'Flying Circus' and left of 'No More Heroes'

content.description: This route makes a nice warm up for the others at Blackmith Wall or if you are on your way to the Hardware Wall.   Start by climbing up and making a somewhat awkward move to gain a stance at the 2nd bolt.  Climb up and into the shallow right facing dihedral.   Pull the small overhang and work your way to the anchors.
content.protection: bolts, shares anchors with Flying Circus, 5.11b.
content.location: This route is the 2nd route from the left on the right hand side of the cliff.   To access, cross the creek downstream from Blacksmith proper and follow a faint trail up the hill to reach a hand line to gain access to the belay platform.

content.description: The crux is getting to the first bolt and through the first two or three.  After that it eases significantly.  You start with decent crimps and end with juggy sidepulls.
Work your wall up the lower angle rock to reach an overhang.  Pull the overhang and find a stance to clip the last bolt.   Crux is making it to the anchors.
content.protection: bolts, shares anchors with Peaches on the Beaches, 5.11a.
content.location: This route is the 3rd route from the left on the right hand side of the cliff.   To access, cross the creek downstream from Blacksmith proper and follow a faint trail up the hill to reach a hand line to gain access to the belay platform.

content.description: Shorter, bouldery route which climbs an obvious streak.
content.location: This is on the right side of the wall. I believe there is still an open project to the right of this climb.
